title._content: The Touchstone Garden, 118-120 East 30th Street, New York, New York (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. [The Touchstone Garden, 118-120 East 30th Street, New York, New York Pergola] [1919 summer] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. Landscape: George E. Fowler, architect for The Touchstone magazine; Eloise Roorbach, garden editor of The Touchstone magazine, from 1917. Hartmann-Sanders supplied the arbor. Other: This was the garden The Touchstone magazine townhouse offices. Today: Houses, but not garden, extant. On slide (handwritten): "Touchstone." Also, blue star sticker. On slide (printed), but obscured by handwritten label: "[..] York." (Slide manufactured by T.H. McAllister-Keller Co., 176 Fulton St., New York) Slide for lecturing on city and suburban gardens. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16117 Call Number: LC-J717-X98- 43
